member.name: P:Silk.NET.Vulkan.Chain.HeadPtr
member.summary: Gets a pointer to the current head.

member.name: P:Silk.NET.Vulkan.Chain.Size
member.summary: Gets the total size (in bytes) of the unmanaged memory, managed by this chain.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.Vulkan.Chain.Clear(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clears this instance by setting each element of the chain to default, whilst maintaining the and .
member.param: If true will also clear the head of the chain; otherwise, will not touch the head if false
member.returns: This instance.

remarks.para: Note, unlike many of the other length modifying methods, this does not return a new instance, if you wish to create a cleared instance with the same types, first use .

member.name: M:Silk.NET.Vulkan.Chain.Duplicate
member.summary: Creates a new by copying this instance.
member.returns: A duplicate of this instance.

remarks.para: Do not forget to dispose this chain if you are no longer using it.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.Vulkan.Chain.DoDuplicate
member.summary: Creates a new by copying this instance.

remarks.para: Do not forget to dispose this chain if you are no longer using it.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.Vulkan.Chain.AddAny``1(``0)
member.summary: Creates a new with 2 items, by appending to the end of this instance.

remarks.para: Do not forget to dispose this chain if you are no longer using it.

The `Any` versions of chain methods do not validate that items belong in the chain, this is useful for situations where the specification does not indicate required chain constraints. You should generally try to use the none `Any` version in preference.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.Vulkan.ChainExtensions.AddNext``2(``0@,``1@)
member.summary: Adds a structure to the end of the chain.
member.param: The structure added to the end of the chain

The type of the structure to add

To use specify the output type required, e.g.:
remarks.code: PhysicalDeviceFeatures2 .BaseInStructure(out var features2) .AddNext(out PhysicalDeviceDescriptorIndexingFeatures indexingFeatures) .AddNext(out PhysicalDeviceAccelerationStructureFeaturesKhr accelerationStructureFeaturesKhr);
remarks.para: Note, the value is always added, even if an equivalent value is added in the chain already. Use to only add if not already present.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.Vulkan.Vk.TryGetInstanceExtension``1(Silk.NET.Vulkan.Instance,``0@,System.String)
member.summary: Attempts to load the given instance extension.
member.param: The instance to load the extension from.
The loaded instance extension, or null if load failed.
member.remarks: This function doesn't check that the extension is enabled - you will get an error later on if you attempt to call an extension function from an extension that isn't loaded.
member.returns: Whether the extension is available and loaded.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.Vulkan.Vk.TryGetDeviceExtension``1(Silk.NET.Vulkan.Instance,Silk.NET.Vulkan.Device,``0@,System.String)
member.summary: Attempts to load the given device extension.
member.param: The instance to load the extension from.
The device to load the extension from.
The loaded device extension, or null if load failed.
member.remarks: This function doesn't check that the extension is enabled - you will get an error later on if you attempt to call an extension function from an extension that isn't loaded.
member.returns: Whether the extension is available and loaded.

member.summary: Checks whether the given instance extension is available.
